intro: Waltheria erioclada, commonly known as the velvetleaf or swamp hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety texture. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to red, typically blooming during the warmer months. It thrives in moist, swampy environments and is often found near water bodies. Waltheria erioclada is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes other hibiscus and cotton species.
